word_mean: 更接近某个参照点的。反义词为distal

sentence.Network_en: 75 % of postbulbar ulcers occur proximal to the duodenal papilla.
sentence.Network_cn: 75%的球后溃疡发生在十二指肠乳头近侧.

sentence.Network_en: Endothelial cells proximal to the injury undergo rapid mitosis.
sentence.Network_cn: 近损伤部位的内皮细胞进行迅速的有丝分裂.

sentence.Network_en: Chromosome 5 is distinguished by a proximal knob.
sentence.Network_cn: 第5染色体的特点是有一个近侧的节结.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent. (as a term in anatomy and zoology): from Latin proximus 'nearest' + -al. In geology, usage dates from the 1940s

means.word_mean: 1. situated nearest to point of attachment or origin;

auth_sentence.content: The proximal demonstration of this voter discontent is found in the Tea Party movement.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The proximal demonstration of this voter discontent is found in the Tea Party movement.

auth_sentence.content: Our illusions regarding control cause us to dismiss the dangers of proximal risk and amplify those of distant and unlikely risks.
auth_sentence.res_content: Our illusions regarding control cause us to dismiss the dangers of proximal risk and amplify those of distant and unlikely risks.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Our illusions regarding control cause us to dismiss the dangers of proximal risk and amplify those of distant and unlikely risks.

auth_sentence.content: While it seems to be much weaker than proximal quantum effects, it is effective over an enormous range of distance.
